addition.36: *   <li>If {@code plusForSpace} was specified, the space character " " is converted into a plus
addition.38: *   <li>All other characters are converted into one or more bytes using UTF-8 encoding and each
addition.39: *       byte is then represented by the 3-character string "%XX", where "XX" is the two-digit,
addition.40: *       uppercase, hexadecimal representation of the byte value.
addition.62: /** If true we should convert space to the {@code +} character. */
addition.156: /** Escapes the given Unicode code point in UTF-8. */

removed.35: * <li>If {@code plusForSpace} was specified, the space character " " is converted into a plus sign
removed.37: * <li>All other characters are converted into one or more bytes using UTF-8 encoding and each byte
removed.38: *     is then represented by the 3-character string "%XX", where "XX" is the two-digit, uppercase,
removed.39: *     hexadecimal representation of the byte value.
removed.62: * If true we should convert space to the {@code +} character.
